com.martinandersson.money.lib.model

Class MoneyPrice

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.martinandersson.money.lib.model.MoneyPrice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Price, java.io.Serializable

    public class MoneyPrice
extends java.lang.Object
implements Price, java.io.Serializable
    Represents an adjusted close, internally stored as a Money.

    Money is a MonetaryAmount implementation from the reference implementation of JSR-354.

    The currency used is "USD".

    Please note that this implementation implements Serializable, but not Externalizable. The serialization protocol has not been customized (method writeObject() and readObject() is not implemented).

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • ofJson

        public static MoneyPrice ofJson(java.time.LocalDate date,
                                javax.json.JsonNumber adjClose)
        Construct a new MoneyPrice using specified date and adjClose.

        Parameters:
        date - date of the adjusted closing price
        adjClose - adjusted close
        Returns:
        a new MoneyPrice
        Implementation Note:
        If you study the source code of Moneta, you shall find that whatever non-BigDecimal value we pass to Moneta's factories, a new BigDecimal value will be created. It is understandable since a BigDecimal is exactly what Money uses internally. Hence, JsonNumber.bigDecimalValue() is used to extract the adjusted close.
